App.name: App
App.description: The App class defines the main object of the applications

Mootor.name: Mootor
Mootor.description: The Event class defines and manage events
Mootor.author: Martin Szyszlican (martinsz [at] gmail.com)

Router.name: Router
Router.description: The Route class is for defining a route

UI.name: UI
UI.description:
The UI class is the class for all user interface elements.
It is not directly used, but extended by many other classes.

View.name: View
View.description:
The View class handles each view of the application. 
A list of views is specified in the applications options
and the files are loaded from the "views" folder.
Each view has a viewName.js, viewName.html and viewName.css files.

App.name: App
App.description: The App class defines the main object of the applications

params.name: options
params.description:
An object defining options for the application.
* views - An array with a list of view names

Context.name: Context
Context.description: Information about the context of the application (ej: device's viewport)
Context.author: Martin Szyszlican (martinsz [at] gmail.com)

Event.description: The Event class defines and manage events

Router.description: The Router class is for defining routes

UI.name: UI
UI.description:
The UI class is the class for all user interface elements.
It is not directly used, but extended by many other classes.
UI.author: Martin Szyszlican (martinsz [at] gmail.com)

UIApp.name: UIApp
UIApp.description: The UIApp class is the UI representation of an app
UIApp.author: Martin Szyszlican (martinsz [at] gmail.com)

UIButton.name: UIButton
UIButton.description: UIButton is a button element, it uses UIForm to extend elements with aria-roles
UIButton.author: Martin Szyszlican (martinsz [at] gmail.com)

UIFooter.name: UIFooter
UIFooter.description: The UIFooter class is a navigational element at the bottom of the page (footer)
UIFooter.author: Martin Szyszlican (martinsz [at] gmail.com)

UIForm.name: UIForm
UIForm.description: The UIForm is a form to input data
UIForm.author: Martin Szyszlican (martinsz [at] gmail.com)

UIFormCamera.name: UIFormCamera
UIFormCamera.description: UIFormCamera is a camera pseudo-input of a form
UIFormCamera.author: Emilio Mariscal (emi420 [at] gmail.com)

UIFormCheckbox.name: UIFormCheckbox
UIFormCheckbox.description: UIFormCheckbox is a checkbox input of a form
UIFormCheckbox.author: Emilio Mariscal (emi420 [at] gmail.com)

UIFormDate.name: UIFormDate
UIFormDate.description: UIFormDate is a date input of a form
UIFormDate.author: Emilio Mariscal (emi420 [at] gmail.com)

UIFormDraw.name: UIFormDraw
UIFormDraw.description: UIFormDraw is a draw pseudo-input of a form
UIFormDraw.author: Emilio Mariscal (emi420 [at] gmail.com)

UIFormFieldset.name: UIFormFieldset
UIFormFieldset.description: UIFormFieldset is a fieldset item of a form
UIFormFieldset.author: Emilio Mariscal (emi420 [at] gmail.com)

UIFormGeo.name: UIFormGeo
UIFormGeo.description: UIFormGeo is a date pseudo-input of a form
UIFormGeo.author: Emilio Mariscal (emi420 [at] gmail.com)

UIFormInput.name: UIFormInput
UIFormInput.description: UIFormInput is an input item of a form
UIFormInput.author: Emilio Mariscal (emi420 [at] gmail.com)

UIFormOption.name: UIFormOption
UIFormOption.description: UIFormOption is a option input of a form
UIFormOption.author: Emilio Mariscal (emi420 [at] gmail.com)

UIFormPassword.name: UIFormPassword
UIFormPassword.description: UIFormPassword is a password input of a form
UIFormPassword.author: Emilio Mariscal (emi420 [at] gmail.com)

UIFormSelect.name: UIFormSelect
UIFormSelect.description: UIFormSelect is a select input of a form
UIFormSelect.author: Martin Szyszlican (martinsz [at] gmail.com)

UIFormText.name: UIFormText
UIFormText.description: UIFormText is a text input of a form
UIFormText.author: Martin Szyszlican (martinsz [at] gmail.com)

UIFormTextArea.name: UIFormTextArea
UIFormTextArea.description: UIFormTextArea is a textarea input of a form
UIFormTextArea.author: Martin Szyszlican (martinsz [at] gmail.com)

UIFormTime.name: UIFormTime
UIFormTime.description: UIFormTime is a time input of a form
UIFormTime.author: Emilio Mariscal (emi420 [at] gmail.com)

UIFormToggleSwitch.name: UIFormToggleSwitch
UIFormToggleSwitch.description: UIFormToggleSwitch is a toggle switch pseudo-input of a form
UIFormToggleSwitch.author: Emilio Mariscal (emi420 [at] gmail.com)

UIFormVirtualInput.name: UIFormVirtualInput
UIFormVirtualInput.description: UIFormVirtualInput is a virtual-input item of a form
UIFormVirtualInput.author: Emilio Mariscal (emi420 [at] gmail.com)

UIHeader.name: UIHeader
UIHeader.description: The UIHeader class is a navigational element at the top of the page (header)
UIHeader.author: Martin Szyszlican (martinsz [at] gmail.com)

UILoading.name: UILoading

UILoading.author: Martin Szyszlican (martinsz [at] gmail.com)

UINavBar.name: UINavBar
UINavBar.description: The UINavBar class is a navigational element at the top or bottom of the page (header or footer)
UINavBar.author: Martin Szyszlican (martinsz [at] gmail.com)

UINavItem.name: UINavItem
UINavItem.description: The UINavItem is an item of a UINavBar, like an action button or an anchor link
UINavItem.author: Martin Szyszlican (martinsz [at] gmail.com)

UIView.name: UIView
UIView.description: The UIView class is the UI representation of a view
UIView.author: Martin Szyszlican (martinsz [at] gmail.com)

View.name: View
View.description:
The View class handles each view of the application. 
A list of views is specified in the applications options
and the files are loaded from the "views" folder.
Each view has a viewName.js, viewName.html and viewName.css files.

params.name: options
params.description:
An object defining options for the current view.
* constructor - A function that will be run after the view has loaded (optional).
* animation - a string defining the type of animation used to show this view (one of: "slide-left", "slide-right", "none").

View.author: Martin Szyszlican (martinsz [at] gmail.com)

classitems.description:
Stores the navigation history. 
An array of views, ordered in the sequence that they were visited by the user.
classitems.name: history

classitems.description:
The application's version number
Note: It's not Mootor version, this value is defined in application code, not framework code.
classitems.name: version

classitems.description:
Application settings
If called with a key, returns the value. If called with key and value, sets value to key.
classitems.name: settings

classitems.description: Go to the previous view in the history
classitems.name: back

classitems.description:
Creates a new app with the defined options.
If the app is already created, it can be called without options to have a reference to the Mootor app. 

App instance factory
classitems.name: app

params.name: views
params.description: A list of view names to be initialized

classitems.name: extend

classitems.description: The URL regex referenced by this route
classitems.name: regex

classitems.description:
The view that implements this route
If called with no parameters, it returns the currently set view in this route.
classitems.name: view

params.name: view
params.description: - The view that implements this route

classitems.name: route
el

classitems.description: Shows element (not necesarily, since the element's parent might be hidden or out of view)
classitems.name: show

params.name: Constructor
params.description: An object with a private _init method

params.name: state
params.description: State of the input, true if disabled false if enabled

params.name: state
params.description: State of the input, true if disabled false if enabled

classitems.description: Sets an event handler for the input
classitems.name: on

params.name: event
params.description: Defines in which event the handler will be called

params.name: callback
params.description: The function to be called when the event is fired.

classitems.description:
Title
The text to display in the header
If called with no arguments returns the current title
classitems.name: title

params.name: show
params.description: Show or hide the loading indicator

classitems.description: Create and add the loading indicator's elements to the DOM
classitems.name: create

classitems.description: Set the style for the loading animation
classitems.name: style

params.name: options
params.description: Style options TODO: Define this object's structure

classitems.description:
Move the element to the specified position inside the UIApp / m-views-container. 
If coordinates are not specified, it returns coordinates object with the current position.
classitems.name: position

params.name: transition
params.description: Transition type. MUST be one of: slide-left, slide-right, none

classitems.description: Set callback function for an event
classitems.name: on

classitems.description: Init View instance, load HTML, CSS and JavaScript files for the view

Title is the friendly name for the current view.
When called without parameters, returns a string containing the title. When called with parameters, sets the title.
classitems.name: title

classitems.description:
Sets an event handler for the view
Possible values for event: load, beforeLoad, unload, beforeUnload, init
classitems.name: on

params.name: event
params.description: Defines in which event the handler will be called

params.name: callback
params.description: The function to be called when the event is fired.

classitems.description:
Unsets event handlers for the view
Possible values for event: load, beforeLoad, unload, beforeUnload, init
classitems.name: off

params.name: event
params.description: Defines in which event we want to unset handlers

params.name: callback
params.description: If this parameter is specified, only that function is removed. Otherwise all callbacks for this event are removed.

params.name: options
params.description: The options object for the view
